properties.name: Cathedral Trail 5 mi
properties.description: The beginning and end of this Pilgrimage is the Archdiocese of Cincinnati’s Cathedral, the seat of the Archbishop, heir of the Apostles. The Bishops, in union with the Bishop of Rome (the Pope), are responsible for our spiritual welfare and have established parishes throughout their dioceses for our spiritual needs.  The Churches along this trail, in or near downtown Cincinnati, are old parishes with beautiful interiors and exteriors, rich histories and have served the needs of the faithful for many generations. The map indicates existing churches, former churches and where churches were in the distant past.
Head E on W 8th St toward Plum St.
Turn left onto E 8th St. and continue to St. Louis Church
Head E on E 8th St toward Walnut St
Turn right onto Sycamore St. and continue to St. Francis Xavier Church
Head S on Sycamore St toward E 6th St.
Turn left onto E 4th St. and enter into the Lytle Park Historic District
Head NE on E 4th St toward Pike St.
Turn left onto E Pete Rose Way
Head NW over Columbia Parkway (SR 50). Take the stairs and bridge.
Turn left onto St. Gregory Street
Turn right onto stairs up to Holy Cross Immaculata Church
Head N on Guido St toward Pavilion St.
The (former) Holy Cross Monastery & Chapel is at the top of the hill. The Chapel is on the right down St Paul Place.
Head S on St Paul Place.
Turn left into the Celestial parking lot, next to the Rookwood Pottery and stop at the flag pole. This point has a great view westward to downtown Cincinnati.
Leave the parking lot and to the bearing left past the Rookwood Pottery
Turn left onto Monastery St. and go down the hill
Turn left toward Gilbert Ave. Take the stairs
Turn right onto Gilbert Ave. Take the stairs
Turn left onto E Court St.
Turn left onto E Central Parkway
Turn left onto E Central Parkway
Turn left onto E 13th St. continue to Old St. Mary’s Church
Head W on E 13th St toward Clay St.
Turn left onto E Liberty St.
Turn right onto Vine St. and continue to St. Francis Seraph Church & Friary
Head S on Vine St toward W Liberty St.
Turn right onto W 8th St. and you arrive back at the Saint Peter in Chains Cathedral.

properties.name: Cathedral Trail 11.4 mi
properties.description: This trail visits many of the same parishes along the 5 Mile trail, but also travels out of the Downtown basin and up onto the hilltop neighborhoods immediately near Downtown and includes many second generation parishes in the growth of the Archdiocese.
Head E on W 8th St toward Plum St.
Turn left onto E 8th St. and continue to St. Louis Church
Head E on E 8th St toward Walnut St
Turn right onto Sycamore St. and continue to St. Francis Xavier Church
Head North on Sycamore St toward New St
Take the stairs over the highway
Turn right onto Van Meter St.
Go past the Rookwood Pottery to the parking lot and stop at the flag pole. This point has a great view westward to downtown Cincinnati.
Leaving the parking lot, turn left down Celestial St..
Continue to the corner of Jerome St. and bear left
Take the St Paul Place stairs (on the left) up the hill to the The (former) Holy Cross Monastery & Chapel.
Turn right onto Guido St. Holy Cross Immaculata Church will be on the right.
Head west, down the long stairs (These are the steps people pray on Good Friday)
Turn left (down) onto St Gregory St
Turn left at Celestial St. Take the stairs down
Turn left onto Adams Crossing. Take the stairs
Adams Crossing turns slightly right and becomes Parsons St
Continue eastward to St. Rose Church (on the right)
Head west on Riverside Dr toward Lumber St
Turn left to stay on Collins Ave
Turn left onto William Howard Taft Rd
Continue West. St Francis De Sales will be on the rt.
Turn right (west) on E McMillan St
Turn right at Victory parkway to St. Anthony of Padua Church
Leaving the Church, turn to the left (south)
Turn right onto E McMillan St
Holy Name Church will be on the left
Head north on Auburn Ave toward E McMillan St
Cross E McMillan St and continue to William Howard Taft Road.
Turn left onto William Howard Taft Road
William Howard Taft Road becomes Calhoun St
Where Calhoun St ends, turn left onto Clifton Ave.
Turn right W McMillan St (going west)
St. Monica / St. George Church will be on the right
Turn right into the Fairview Park
Continue up the hill to the viewing area on the left.
Return back down the street to Ravine St.
Turn right (south) onto Ravine St and go down the street
Continue south on Central Pkwy to W 8th St
Turn left onto W 8th St and you arrive back at the Saint Peter in Chains Cathedral.

properties.name: East Side Trail - East Route
properties.description: Picture The theme for the East Side Trails is the journey to Ordination. The East Side Trails are Pilgrimages toward the Archdiocese of Cincinnati’s Seminary, The Athenaeum Of Ohio. These Pilgrimages are a physical manifestation of the spiritual journey of the men whom God has called to the ordained priesthood. The East Route trail begins at St Bernadette and continues to St Thomas More, Immaculate Heart of Mary, Guardian Angels and finally at the Athenaeum.   (Please note that trail route is along Beechmont Ave / Ohio Pike / St. Rt. 125 with has fast traffic and few sidewalks.)
Head east on Locust Lake Rd toward Jenny Lind Rd
Locust Lake Rd turns slightly left and becomes Oak St
Turn left onto OH-125/Beechmont St/Ohio Pike.
Continue to follow OH-125/Ohio Pike. St. Thomas More will be on the right.
Head west on OH-125 W/Ohio Pike
Continue to follow OH-125 West. Immaculate Heart of Mary Church will be on the right

properties.directions: Head west on OH-125 W/Beechmont Ave.
Go past the Athenaeum of Ohio. Guardian Angels will be on the left

properties.description: Head southeast on Beechmont Ave toward Berkshire Rd. The Athenaeum of Ohio will be on the left

properties.name: West Side Trail - South Loop
properties.description: As the Archdiocese of Cincinnati’s population grew the people began to push up and out of the Ohio River valley and began to spread to the west.  The South Loop contains the oldest parishes on the West Side. The starting and ending point for the South Loop is St. Lawrence Church.  Other parishes along the route include; Holy Family Church, St. William Church, St. Teresa of Avila Catholic Church, St Antoninus Church and Our Lady of Lourdes Church.
Head SE, then East on Warsaw Ave.
Opposite Hawthorne Ave., is the old gateway to the previous location of the Athenaeum of Ohio.
Turn left onto W 8th St. Holy Family Church will be on the left.
Head west on W 8th St toward Hawthorne Ave
Turn right onto W 8th St. Travel West on W 8th St. St. William Church will be on the right.
Turn left onto St Lawrence Ave
Travel NW on Glenway Ave. St. Teresa of Avila will be on the left. (The old church building is on Overlook Ave.)
St. Teresa of Avila Catholic Church
Turn left onto Cleves Warsaw Ave / Cleves Warsaw Pk. Continue to follow Cleves Warsaw Pk
Turn right onto Linneman Rd. St Antoninus Church will be on the right.

properties.directions: Head North on Linneman Rd toward Julmar Dr
Continue straight onto Muddy Creek Rd
Turn left onto Rosebud Dr. Our Lady of Lourdes Church will be on the right

properties.description: Head NE on Lumardo Ave toward Glenway Ave
SE onto Warsaw Ave. St Lawrence Church, the starting point, will be on the left.

properties.name: West Side Trail - North Loop
properties.description: Picture The West Side - North Loop Trail is in the western part of Cincinnati.  The starting and ending point is Our Lady of Visitation Church. Other parishes along the route include; St Jude Church,  St Aloysius Gonzaga Church, St Martin of Tours Church and St Catharine of Siena Church.
Turn right onto Bridgetown Rd. and walk East. St. Jude Church will be on the left
Head northeast on Bridgetown Rd. St. Aloysius Gonzaga will be on the Left.
Turn right onto Glenmore Ave, walk South. St. Martin of Tours Church will be on the right
Slight left onto Fischer Pl. St. Catharine of Siena Church will be on the left.

properties.directions: Head west on Fischer Pl toward Wunder Ave
Turn right onto South Rd Our Lady of Visitation Church, the starting point, will be on the right.

properties.name: Central Trail
properties.description: Picture The Central Trail is in the downtown Dayton area. It visits eight parishes and the chapel at the University of Dayton. Part of the hike will be along the Great Miami River.  The Churches along the Central Trail are Emmanuel Church, Sacred Heart Church, St Joseph Church, Holy Trinity Church, Holy Family, St. Anthony of Padua Church, St. Mary Church, the Chapel of the Immaculate Conception at the University of Dayton and the Holy Angels Church.  The trail is a loop trail starting and ending at the Emmanuel Church.
Head east on Franklin St toward S Ludlow St
Turn left onto S Ludlow St
Continue North on S Wilkinson St Arriving at Sacred Heart Church
Turn left onto S St Clair St
Between 2nd St and 3rd St is Cooper Park. Across from the park is a parking lot. It formally held a building where Masses were held.
Turn right onto Ice Ave. Masses were first held at the Conway family home in the Ice Alley.
Turn right onto N Patterson Blvd
Head west on E 2nd St toward Madison St
Head east to S Findlay St
Turn right (West) onto St Charles Ave
Head north on Bowen St toward Xenia Ave
Turn right onto E Stewart St
The Chapel of the Immaculate Conception
Head west on L St toward Brown St
Turn left onto E Stewart St
Turn right onto Great Miami River Recreational Trail/S Patterson Blvd
Turn left onto Great Miami River Recreational Trail. Continue to follow Great Miami River Recreational Trail
Slight right toward W Washington St
Turn right onto W Washington St
Turn left onto S Perry St

properties.name: North Trail
properties.description: The western route of the North Trail is in the northern portion of the Archdiocese in the area  known as "The Land of the Cross - Tipped Churches."  This trail is mostly along country roads.  It begins at St. Henry Church in St. Henry, Ohio and includes St. Francis, Nativity of the Blessed Virgin Mary, St. Rose, St. John the Baptist and concludes at Maria Stein Shrine of the Holy Relics.
Head east on OH-119 E/E Main St toward S Walnut St. Continue to follow OH-119 E
Turn left onto Fort Recovery-Minster Rd St. Francis will be on the left.
Head east on Fort Recovery-Minster Rd toward Cranberry Rd
Turn right onto OH-119 E Nativity of the Blessed Virgin Mary will be on the right.
The Nativity of the Blessed Virgin Mary
Head east on OH-119 E St Rose Church will be on the right.
Head east on OH-119 E toward Clune Stucke Rd. St. John the Baptist will be on the left
Head west on OH-119 W toward St Johns Rd
Turn right onto St Johns Rd The Maria Stein Shrine will be on the left.
Maria Stein Shrine of the Holy Relics

properties.name: East Side Trail - West Route red line
properties.description: The West Route Trail is similar in concept to the East Route.  The Trail is a loop trail. It begins at the former Seminary's location which is now called the Our Lady of the Holy Spirit Center.  From there the trail goes to Holy Trinity Church, the Church of the Nativity of our Lord, St Cecila, St Mary Church (Hyde Park), Christ the King parish then returns to the starting point.  In the future, once a pedestrian bridge is completed over the Little Miami River, the trail will continue to the current Seminary, The Athenaeum Of Ohio.
